comment.author: 23578571@N06
comment._content: On the basis of physical resemblance, it's possible this is Sir Daniel Wilson, professor at the University of Toronto from 1853 to 1892 -- though I'm not sure why his portrait would be held by LSUC. Toronto was very small in those days and he was very active in society, though. Compare with his portraits as a younger man in Marinell Ash's biography Thinking With Both Hands (ed. Elizabeth Hulse) and at this link.

comment.author: 38561291@N04
comment._content: You are absolutely correct - it is Daniel Wilson. I checked the University of Toronto history by Martin Friedland and this exact photograph appears on page 46. Thanks very much for your help!
comment.authorname: Law Society of Upper Canada Archives
